questions: Complete the sentence: The Berlin Wall symbolised the division between the capitalist and the ________ world.

Correct and rewrite the statement: The Soviet Union had become stagnant in an administrative and political sense as well. Nikita Khrushchev promised to reform the economy, catch up with the west, and loosen the administrative system.
answers: Mikhail Gorbachev- The Soviet Union had become stagnant in an administrative and political sense as well. Mikhail Gorbachev promised to reform the economy, catch up with the west, and loosen the administrative system.

answers: The economy was planned and controlled by the state.

questions: Which one of the following was NOT given primacy by the makers of the Soviet System? a. b. c. d.  Abolition of private property. Society based on the principle of equality. No opposition party to be allowed. No state control over economy.  [CBSE (AI) 2016]

Which one of the following statements about the Berlin wall is false? a. b. c. d.  It symbolized the division between the Capitalist and the Communist world. It was built immediately after the Second World War. It was broken by the people on 9th November, 1989. It marked the unification of the two parts of Germany.
answers: (d) It marked the unification of the two parts of Germany

questions: How many republics were involved in Soviet Union?
answers: Soviet Union was a group of 15 republics.

questions: Give an example of an authoritarian President.

questions: For which plants did Soviet Union provide economic assistance?
answers: Soviet union gave aid and technical assistance for steel plants at Bhilai, Bokaro, Vishakhapatnam and machinery plants like Bharat Heavy Electrical Ltd., etc.

questions: Write the full form of CIS.

answers: Bill Clinton was the President of USA for eight years. He belonged to ‘Democratic Party’.
